MaterialRawSalvage.name: Salvage
MaterialRawSalvage.description: Salvage that can be recycled into other resources at a Refinery.

MaterialExplosive.name: Explosive Powder
MaterialExplosive.description: Resource used for producing heavy explosive weapons.

MaterialRawComponentsDamaged.name: Damaged Components
MaterialRawComponentsDamaged.description: Damaged Components that can be salvaged into Components.

MaterialRawComponents.name: Components
MaterialRawComponents.description: Components that can be salvaged into Refined Mateirals at a Refinery.

MaterialRawSulfur.name: Sulfur
MaterialRawSulfur.description: Sulfur that can be refined into Heavy Explosive Powder at a Refinery.

MaterialRawRareMetals.name: Rare Metal
MaterialRawRareMetals.description: A compound of extremely rare metals used in the production of the most advanced vehicles and weapons.

MaterialHeavyExplosive.name: Heavy Explosive Powder
MaterialHeavyExplosive.description: Resource used for producing heavy explosive weapons.

MaterialRawCoal.name: Coal
MaterialRawCoal.description: Chunks of raw Coal that can be refined into materials needed for production and power generation at Facilities.

MaterialCoke.name: Coke
MaterialCoke.description: Refined Coal required for various Facility processes.

general: Not to be confused with the product you consume

MaterialConstruction.name: Construction Materials
MaterialConstruction.description: Metal beams needed to produce basic structures and vehicles at Facilities.

MaterialProcessedConstruction.name: Processed Construction Materials
MaterialProcessedConstruction.description: Refined metal bars needed to produce advanced structures and vehicles at Facilities.

MaterialSteel.name: Steel Construction Materials
MaterialSteel.description: Shaped, steel beams required for most advanced processes at Facilities.

MaterialRareAlloys.name: Rare Alloys
MaterialRareAlloys.description: Bars of incredibly rare materials used in some of the most advanced and complex constructions, such as large naval vessels and AEON Rockets.

MaterialThermalShielding.name: Thermal Shielding
MaterialThermalShielding.description: Heat-absorbant metal shielding that protects even the most volatile materials from the elements, preventing unwanted explosions.

MaterialUnstableSubstances.name: Unstable Substances
MaterialUnstableSubstances.description: A reinforced barrel of extremely explosive substances required for the deadliest warheads.

AssemblyMaterialsT1.name: Assembly Materials I
AssemblyMaterialsT1.description: Specialized metal sheets forged using Coal that are required to assembly advanced vehicles and equipment.

AssemblyMaterialsT2.name: Assembly Materials II
AssemblyMaterialsT2.description: Specialized metal bars fortified with Petrol that are required to assemble advanced vehicles and equipment.

AssemblyMaterialsT3.name: Assembly Materials III
AssemblyMaterialsT3.description: Sufluer-enriched metallic bars that are required to assemble advanced vehicles and equipment.

AssemblyMaterialsT4.name: Assembly Materials IV
AssemblyMaterialsT4.description: High-end steel bars, fortified with Heavy Oil that are required to assemble advanced vehicles and equipment.

AssemblyMaterialsT5.name: Assembly Materials V
AssemblyMaterialsT5.description: Meticulously engineered alloy beams that are required to assemble advanced vehicles and equipment.

MaterialDiesel.name: Diesel
MaterialDiesel.description: Common fuel used to power all vehicles and resource mines.

MaterialOilCrude.name: Oil
MaterialOilCrude.description: A raw viscous liquid that must be refined into fuel at Facilities.

MaterialOilPetrol.name: Petrol
MaterialOilPetrol.description: A medium grade fuel that's refined from Oil. Used as higher end fuel for vehicles and in various applications at Facilities.

MaterialOilHeavy.name: Heavy Oil
MaterialOilHeavy.description: A high grade fuel that's refined from Oil. Used in a variety of applications at Facilities.

MaterialOilEnriched.name: Enriched Oil
MaterialOilEnriched.description: Oil that has been purified and enriched for advanced Facilities processes.

UtilityBarbedWire.name: Barbed Wire
UtilityBarbedWire.description: Used to construct Barbed Wire defenses.

UtilityMetalBeam.name: Metal Beam
UtilityMetalBeam.description: Used to construct Barbed Metal Beam defenses.

Pipe.name: Pipe
Pipe.description: Used to construct various types of pipelines for transporting liquids.

MaterialConcrete.name: Concrete Materials
MaterialConcrete.description: A concrete compound that is used to build heavily fortified structures.

MeleeMace.name: Falias Raiding Club
MeleeMace.description: A heavy mace constructed from solid wood and dotted with lead rivets. Commonly used when raiding entrenched positions in close quarters where firearms are less effective and an old-fashioned bludgeoning is better suited for the job.

general: Grass grows, birds fly, sun shines, and brotha'- I hurt people!

MeleeSword.name: Eleos Infantry Dagger
MeleeSword.description: Standard-issue Mesean military dagger. Its long, slender blade excels in close-quarters combat as well as plethora of uses in everyday operations.

general: DRIVE ME CLOSER, I WANT TO HIT THEM WITH MY... dagger?

ARBooker.name: Booker Storm Rifle Model 838
ARBooker.description: The Booker is a high-impact three-round burst Storm Rifle for those who like to shoot first.

general: Equipped with a high velocity barrel that deals 20% extra damage per shot

ATRifle.name: 20 Neville Anti-Tank Rifle
ATRifle.description: The Neville is unmatched in its versatility as a portable, magazine-based anti-armour firearm.

general: Causes suppressed enemy players to lose stability

RifleSniperAuger.name: KRR3-792 Auger
RifleSniperAuger.description: A Kraunian rifle modified for long-range engagements. It doesn't have the range or stopping power of other marksman rifles but more than makes up for it with unmatched reliability in a range of environments and a superior effective rate of fire.

general: Equipped with a high velocity barrel that deals 55% extra damage per shot
Accuracy bonus provided by cover reduced by 95%

ARDusk.name: "Dusk" ce.III
ARDusk.description: This unique assault rifle includes a high-capacity drum magazine designed for sustained rapid fire.

ATRGreyhound.name: Booker Greyhound Model 910
ATRGreyhound.description: A variant on the Booker Storm Rifle, the Greyhound boasts a larger overall receiver and barrel to accommodate the increased stopping power of anti-tank rounds. Its longer, bulkier barrel allows for increased range. As a heavier automatic rifle, the Greyhound remains an excellent tool for those who'd prefer to shoot before asking questions.

general: Causes suppressed enemy players to lose stability
Equipped with a low velocity barrel that deals 30% less damage per shot

ATRSatterley.name: 228 Satterley Heavy Storm Rifle
ATRSatterley.description: While the Satterley is designed to be operated by a single infantryman, it remains a cumbersome rifle due to its heavy kickback and burst fire configuration. This heavy burst rifle is best suited for small squads to blindside enemy armour, stripping steel with ease, but its cumbersome setup makes it less than ideal for infantry skirmishes.

general: Causes suppressed enemy players to lose stability
Equipped with a low velocity barrel that deals 25% less damage per shot

ATRQuickhatch.name: "Quickhatch" Rt.I
ATRQuickhatch.description: A deadly, long-range sniper rifle with exceptional stopping power. The "Quickhatch" is a gluttnous firearm that hungers for enemy armour and flesh alike.

general: Causes suppressed enemy players to lose stability
Accuracy bonus provided by cover reduced by 95%
Turns enemy heads into fine red mists

ATRDawn.name: "Dawn" Ve.II
ATRDawn.description: A three-round burst anti-tank rifle with a high-capacity magazine. Built from a modified "Dusk" assault rifle, the receiver has been altered to support top-loaded drum magazines for better stability and efficient loading to account for its more cumbersome design and higher calibre rounds.

general: Causes suppressed enemy players to lose stability
Equipped with a low velocity barrel that deals 30% less damage per shot

AmmoMortarIncendiary.name: Incendiary Mortar Shell
AmmoMortarIncendiary.description: An incendiary payload used with mortar tubes. Will ignite objects near impact.

general: Deals High Explosive damage on impact

AmmoMortarShrapnel.name: Shrapnel Mortar Shell
AmmoMortarShrapnel.description: An payload filled with shrapnel used with mortar tubes. Devastates nearby infantry.

AmmoMortarFlare.name: Flare Mortar Shell
AmmoMortarFlare.description: A long-burning flare that ingites midair to illuminate a large aread and reveals enemy targets.

AmmoMortarHE.name: Mortar Shell
AmmoMortarHE.description: An explosive payload used with mortar tubes.

GrenadeATFlask.name: BF5 White Ash Flask Grenade
GrenadeATFlask.description: An explosive flask used for melting enemy armour. This carefully designed liquid bomb explodes into a dazzling flash of molten debris upon impact.

general: High chance of disabling Track subsystem

ATIgnifist.name: Ignifist 30
ATIgnifist.description: This single-use rocket can be fired a short distance. Designed to punch holes into tanks, the Ignifist is the perfect tool for infantry anticipating armoured resistance.

general: High chance to penetrate armoured vehicles

GrenadeATSticky.name: Anti-Tank Sticky Bomb
GrenadeATSticky.description: An adherable grenade designed to penetrate heavy tank armour. The Sticky Bomb can only be thrown a short distance and is ineffective against structures.

general: High chance of disabling Track subsystem

GrenadeSmoke.name: PT-815 Smoke Grenade
GrenadeSmoke.description: A standard smoke grenade designed for concealing allied movement or screening the enemy's vision.

AmmoFlame.name: Flame Ammo
AmmoFlame.description: A drum containing fuel for use with flame weapons.

AmmoRocketHE.name: 3C-High Explosive Rocket
AmmoRocketHE.description: Standard calibre rocket with a heavy explosive payload. Chance to ignite objects near impact.

general: Deals High Explosive damage on impact

AmmoRocketFlame.name: 4C-Fire Rocket
AmmoRocketFlame.description: Standard calibre rocket with an incendiary explosion. Will ignite objects near impact.

general: Deals High Explosive damage on impact
High chance to penetrate armoured vehicles
High chance to penetrate armoured vehicles
Higher base chance to disable vehicle subsystems
Can ruin structures that have been severly damaged by artillery
Can ruin structures that have been severly damaged by artillery

AmmoShell300.name: 300mm
AmmoShell300.description: Standard payload used with Storm Cannons.

general: Can ruin structures that have been severly damaged by artillery

AmmoShell250.name: 250mm
AmmoShell250.description: A shell that is launched over short distances by a spigot mortar.

general: Can ruin structures that have been severly damaged by artillery

APMine.name: Crow's Foot Mine
APMine.description: Anti-infantry mine that delivers a fatal payload to unsuspecting soldiers.

general: $Deactivates after 02d00h when placed outside of a Prepared Mine Field

ATMine.name: Absime AT-99 Mine
ATMine.description: A simple mine that is placed under terrain and fitted with a pressure-sensitive plate to detonate under the weight of heavy vehicles. Mines are visible to friendlies and enemies on foot.

general: $Deactivates after 02d00h when placed outside of a Prepared Mine Field

SeaMine.name: E680-S Rudder Lock
SeaMine.description: Desinged for underwater deployment, Sea Mines detonate upon contact with enemy vessels.

DepthCharge.name: Model-7 "Evie"
DepthCharge.description: An explosive charge that detonates at a target depth. This anti-submarine ordnance is fired from the deck of naval vessels using specialized launchers.

Torpedo.name: Moray Torpedo
Torpedo.description: Fired from submersible vessels, the Moray Torpedo is a self-propelled underwater missile that functions well at a variety of ranges and depths. It's designed to bore into the hulls of large ships, leaving them vulnerable to leaks.

general: Can only be carried by stockpiles
Increased chance to cause a leak

ATBonesawTripod.name: Bonesaw MK.3
ATBonesawTripod.description: This variant of the Bonesaw MK.3 is specially designed for use with tripod mounts. This affords it with increased stability and maximum potential range.

general: This can be attached to certain vehicles

RPGFoebreaker.name: Cutler Foebreaker
RPGFoebreaker.description: This unique duel-barrelled RPG launcher can fire two RPG shells in relatively quick succession. This increase in firepower makes it nearly impossible for a single soldier to operate without the support of a sturdy mount.

general: This can be attached to certain vehicles

MGRatcatcher.name: Malone Ratcatcher MK.1
MGRatcatcher.description: Early iterations of this machinegun were built to be emplaced in bunkers and on the decks of lightly armed warships, the Ratcatcher is Harvey Malone’s first freely mountable infantry weapon designed for field use. Just like its predecessors, this heavy weapon suppresses enemy soldiers with unmatched efficiency.

general: Causes suppressed enemy players to lose stability
This can be attached to certain vehicles

ATRifleTripod.name: "Typhon" ra.XII
ATRifleTripod.description: This mounted anti-tank rifle boasts improved accuracy over its free-standing counterparts. The Typhon was specifically designed with shock absorption in mind, allowing for faster, more consistent firing patterns.

general: Equipped with a high velocity barrel that deals 20% extra damage per shot
This can be attached to certain vehicles

InfantrySupportGun.name: Daucus isg.III
InfantrySupportGun.description: This heavy infantry cannon requires a tripod for stability. The Daucus is designed to give infantry a foothold against enemy vehicles and light fortifications or established fortified garrisons.

MGLamentum.name: Lamentum mm.IV
MGLamentum.description: Built on the bones of the first automatic weapons introduced to the Legion, the "Lamentum" mm.IV is still quite an intimidating force to encounter on the battlefield. Boasting a large magazine and impressive active range, this mounted machinegun excels at laying down consistent suppressive fire.

general: Equipped with a high velocity barrel that deals 50% extra damage per shot
Causes suppressed enemy players to lose stability
This can be attached to certain vehicles

GrenadeLauncherTripod.name: Mounted Fissura gd.I
GrenadeLauncherTripod.description: Capable of firing different grenades, quickly and at long range, the Fissura gd.I is mobile enough for easy transport, while increasing the effectiveness of infantry ordinance.
GrenadeLauncherTripod.ammoUsed: Green Ash Grenade, PT-815 Smoke Grenade, Tremola Grenade GPb-1

general: This can be attached to certain vehicles

UtilityTripod.name: Tripod
UtilityTripod.description: A mount point for deployable infantry weapons and equipment.

SuppliesMaintenance.name: Maintenance Supplies
SuppliesMaintenance.description: Supplies for maintaining structures. Store at Bases or Maintenance Tunnels to prevent decay on surrounding structures.
